intro: Ardisia cuspidata, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen or Christmas berry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Primulaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red, berry-like fruits that are edible for some animals but toxic to humans. Ardisia cuspidata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments. It prefers moist, well-drained soil and is commonly found in tropical and subtropical regions.
